Diagnosis
	1. Left breast cancer - acinic cell carcinoma with LCIS
	Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

	Treatment aim
	Palliative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	None - metastatic at presentation

	Chemotherapy
	1. TCHP commenced 02/2024
	2. Discontinued after 2 cycles due to disease progression
	3. Second-line Kadcyla commenced 04/2024

	Clinical studies
	None suitable

	Current disease status
	Progressive disease in liver

	Current issues
	Worsening liver function
Increasing fatigue
Right upper quadrant pain

	Summary of consultation
	[redacted name] attended today's clinic with her sister. Unfortunately, recent imaging shows clear disease progression with enlarging liver metastases despite second-line treatment with Kadcyla. Her liver function has deteriorated with rising bilirubin (52) and alkaline phosphatase (342). She reports increasing right upper quadrant discomfort requiring regular breakthrough analgesia, and significant fatigue limiting her daily activities.

We have discussed the implications of disease progression and poor response to current treatment. Given her declining performance status (now ECOG 2) and worsening liver function, we have agreed to discontinue Kadcyla. I have outlined the option of third-line treatment with capecitabine, though this would need careful monitoring given her liver function.

	Further investigations
	Urgent liver ultrasound to assess for biliary obstruction
Repeat LFTs in 1 week

	Medication prescribed
	Increased MST to 30mg BD
Metoclopramide 10mg TDS PRN

	Follow up
	Urgent review in 1 week with investigation results
Referral to palliative care team

	Required GP actions
	Please monitor liver function weekly
Consider community palliative care referral
